IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE PRIMARY HEALTHCARE INCLUDING MEDICAL CARE FOR ALL LIFE STAGES, ANCILLARY SERVICES, AND DENTAL SERVICES. SCHEDULE O FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.
IRS990.MissionDesc: AT BROWNSVILLE COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER (BCHC) OUR GOAL IS TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE PRIMARY HEALTH CARE SERVICES WITH EXCELLENCE AND DIGNITY TO OUR COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Desc: BROWNSVILLE CHC PROVIDES PRIMARY HEALTH CARE FOR ALL LIFE CYCLES THROUGH ADULT MEDICINE, WOMEN'S HEALTH, AND PEDIATRICS. SERVICES INCLUDE SICK CHILD VISITS, WELL-CHILD VISITS, PHYSICALS, VISION/HEARING SCREENINGS, IMMUNIZATIONS, AND MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES. DURING THE CALENDAR YEAR 2022, MEDICAL CARE SERVICES PROVIDED A TOTAL OF 61,064 ENCOUNTERS TO 16,443 PATIENTS WITH A STAFF OF 19 FTE PRIMARY PHYSICIANS AND MID-LEVEL PROVIDERS AND 160 FTE NURSES, OTHER MEDICAL STAFF INCLUDING A LABORATORY THAT IS COLA AND OSHA CERTIFIED, RADIOLOGY, FACILITY, NON-CLINICAL SUPPORT STAFF, AND ADMINISTRATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: BROWNSVILLE CHC PROVIDES ON-SITE ENABLING SERVICES. THESE SERVICES INCLUDE SOCIAL SERVICES, CASE MANAGEMENT, PATIENT EDUCATION, AND PHARMACY STAFF AND PHARMACEUTICALS. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR, ENABLING SERVICES PROVIDED A TOTAL OF 6,815 ENCOUNTERS TO 3,270 PATIENTS WITH A STAFF OF 30 FTE'S.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: BROWNSVILLE CHC PROVIDES DENTAL SERVICES INCLUDING DENTAL EXAMS, CLEANINGS, SEALANTS, FILLINGS, EXTRACTIONS, AND PEDIATRIC DENTISTRY. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR, DENTAL SERVICES PROVIDED A TOTAL OF 6,834 ENCOUNTERS TO 2,900 PATIENTS WITH A STAFF OF 7 FTE'S INCLUDING DENTISTS AND DENTAL HYGIENISTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS: MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THEIR INCOME TAX POSITIONS UNDER THE GUIDANCE INCLUDED IN ASC 740. BASED ON THEIR REVIEW, MANAGEMENT HAS NOT IDENTIFIED ANY MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TO BE RECORDED OR DISCLOSED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
OTHER REVENUE INCLUDED ON LINE 1, BUT NOT FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 12: $ 587,040 NET ASSETS RELEASED FROM RESTRICTION
OTHER REVENUE INCLUDED ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 12 BUT NOT LINE 1: $ 4,573,201 TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED CONTRIBUTIONS

PRODUCTIVITY BONUSES: PHYSICIAN SHALL RECEIVE FORTY PERCENT (40%) OF COLLECTIONS FROM VISITS AND PROCEDURES PERFORMED BY PHYSICIAN AT HOSPITAL AND NURSING HOMES, EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING: FEES FOR SERVING AS STAND-BY PHYSICIAN FOR UNASSIGNED PATIENTS (DROP-IN CALL), AND RELATIVE VALUE UNIT (RVU) PAYMENTS FOR UNCOMPENSATED PATIENT CARE. FOR THESE EXCEPTIONS, PHYSICIAN SHALL RECEIVE THE AMOUNT COLLECTED, LESS FIVE PERCENT FOR CLINIC ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. FURTHER, PHYSICIAN SHALL RECEIVE BONUS COMPENSATION TO THE EXTENT PHYSICIAN OBTAINS CERTAIN SPECIFIED PRODUCTIVITY GRADES AND PERFORMANCE GOALS.

ORGANIZATION'S MISSION: THE BROWNSVILLE COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER'S MISSION AND VISION IS TO BE A COMMUNITY ORIENTED COMPREHENSIVE PRIMARY CARE CENTER THAT WILL STRIVE TO MAINTAIN A COMPETITIVE EDGE IN THE CHANGING HEALTH CARE ENVIRONMENT. OUR CORE VALUES INCLUDE EXCELLENCE, TEAMWORK, PERFORMANCE IMPROVEMENT, COMMUNITY ORIENTATION, RESPONSIVENESS TO THE NEEDS OF PATIENT EMPOWERMENT, AND SERVICE TO ALL REGARDLESS OF ABILITY TO PAY AT THE TIME OF SERVICE CONSISTENT WITH THE FEDERAL POVERTY GUIDELINES. THE PURPOSE OF THIS CORPORATION IS TO ESTABLISH AND OPERATE A COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER (CHC) IN THE SERVICE AREA AND TO PROVIDE DIRECT ACCESS TO COMPREHENSIVE PRIMARY HEALTH CARE AND PREVENTIVE HEALTH CARE TO THE RESIDENTS OF THE SERVICE AREA IN A MANNER CONSISTENT WITH THEIR DIGNITY AND IDENTITY, TO PROMOTE COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF THE NEED FOR PREVENTIVE PRIMARY HEALTH CARE, TO DEVELOP AND/OR COORDINATE RESOURCES THAT IMPACT ON THE COMMUNITY'S HEALTH STATUS, TO EMPHASIZE EFFECTIVE PROJECT MANAGEMENT, QUALITY OF CARE, PRODUCTIVITY COMPLIANCE, AND MOVEMENT TOWARD ECONOMIC SELF-SUFFICIENCY, AND TO APPLY FOR GRANTS FROM THE UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT, THE STATE OF TEXAS, OTHER PRIVATE AGENCIES, INCLUDING CONTRACTUAL OR OTHER OPPORTUNITIES TO CARRY OUT THE PURPOSE STATED ABOVE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: REVIEW OF THE FORM 990: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM BASED ON THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR THE YEAR AND INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT OF THE ORGANIZATION. THE FINANCE DIRECTOR REVIEWS THE 990 IN DETAIL AND A COPY OF THE 990 IS INCLUDED WITH EACH BOARD MEMBER'S PACKET ONE WEEK PRIOR TO THE BOARD MEETING. THE 990 IS FIRST PRESENTED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE WHICH MEETS BEFORE THE FULL BOARD. IF APPROVED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE, THE CHAIRMAN SENDS THE 990 WITH A RECOMMENDATION FOR APPROVAL TO THE FULL BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MONITORING COMPLIANCE WITH CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY: ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, ADMINISTRATORS AND NON-BOARD MEMBERS APPOINTED TO BOARD COMMITTEES ARE OBLIGATED TO DECLARE ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH CALENDAR YEAR OR IF ANY SITUATION ARISES THAT WOULD DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY INVOLVE A DECISION THAT WOULD IMPACT THEIR PERSONAL OR PROFESSIONAL INTEREST OR INVOLVEMENT. ALL BOARD MEMBERS, ADMINISTRATORS, OR NON-BOARD MEMBERS APPOINTED TO A BOARD COMMITTEE UPON ELECTION, SELECTION, OR APPOINTMENT, WILL COMPLETE AND SIGN A BROWNSVILLE COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM. IF APPLICABLE, CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS ARE TO BE SUBMITTED TO THE CHAIRPERSON OF THE BROWNSVILLE COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO A BOARD MEETING. THOSE BOARD MEMBERS MAY NOT MAKE A MOTION OR VOTE ON MOTIONS INVOLVING ISSUES FOR WHICH THEY HAVE DECLARED A CONFLICT. REFUSAL OR FAILURE TO DECLARE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST MAY BE THE BASIS FOR TERMINATION OF MEMBERSHIP ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR DISMISSAL AS A MEMBER OF A BOARD COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINES 15A & 15B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION REVIEW: HUMAN RESOURCES CONDUCTS A SALARY COMPARABILITY SURVEY IN ORDER TO HAVE UP TO DATE DATA TO ATTRACT AND RETAIN TALENT OR AS REQUESTED BY THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER. INFORMATION IS COMPILED FROM VETTED SOURCES SUCH AS TWC-BLS AND AN INDEPENDENT THIRD PARTY JOB PRICING VENDOR IF NECESSARY. BCHC ALSO COMPARES AGAINST DATA FROM FEDERAL AND STATE ASSOCIATION ANNUAL SALARY AND BENEFITS REPORTS WHICH INCLUDE JOB PRICING/AGGREGATE DATA FROM OTHER COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS IN A STATE AND NATIONAL LEVELS. THE SALARY SURVEY DATA IS THEN USED AS A BASIS TO DETERMINE SALARY RANGE AND RECOMMENDATIONS. THE SALARY BENCHMARKS AND SOURCES USED WERE PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND APPROVED IN JULY OF 2021. THE HUMAN RESOURCES DIRECTOR PERFORMED A REVIEW OF COMPENSATION FOR THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES. ADDITIONALLY, COMPENSATION DATA AND SOURCES FOR THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER WAS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN JANUARY 2023.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DOCUMENT DISCLOSURE: THROUGH THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT, THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON WRITTEN REQUESTS ADDRESSED TO THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD.
